Hunched over his computer, Tex had been editing his first animated short feature film for over three hours. Through constant polishing and refinement, the project grew from a brief inclination to a grand and heartwarming tale that would guarantee a successful premiere. He leaned back to admire his work, when suddenly the screen flickered and turned black as a thin stream of smoke wafted from the computer. With a sinking feeling, Tex realized that he had not backed up the hard drive that was more than likely melting away, taking months of work with it. Tears welling, his eyes darted across his work area searching desperately for answers. Amongst the myriad of post-it notes framing his monitor, the note that had seemingly always been there presented its innocuous message: "Replace computer fan."

-Xavier Arce. Used by permission of author.
